Components

Breadcrumb

A simple breadcrumb component to improve your navigation experience

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the breadcrumb. Supports sizes (.is-small, .is-medium, .is-large) and alignment (.is-centered, .is-right)
  • items a list that generates the breadcrumb links. The last item automatically poses as the active page

Bulma documentation

  • Home
  • Level one
  • Level two
  • Current page

HTML

<nav class="breadcrumb " aria-label="breadcrumbs">
	<ul>
		<li><a href="#">Home</a></li>
		<li><a href="#">Level one</a></li>
		<li><a href="#">Level two</a></li>
		<li class="is-active"><a href="#" aria-current="page">Current page</a></li>
	</ul>
</nav>

YML data

classes: null
items:
  - Home
  - Level one
  - Level two
  - Current page

Card

Allround flexible card component. Use this template to create your own cards for your project.

Options as passed by the data

  • classes: a list of classnames for the component to use

Bulma documentation

hai

hallootjes

gratis

HTML

<div class="card ">
	<header class="card-header">
		<button class="card-header-icon">
			<a href="#"><img src="../assets/toolkit/images/temp/icon-shopping-cart.svg" alt="Shopping cart icon" class="btn-icon" /></a>
		</button>
	</header>
	<div class="card-image">
		<figure class="image is-square ">
			<img src="./../assets/toolkit/images/choco-eieren.jpeg" alt="Placeholder image" />
		</figure>
	</div>
	<div class="card-content">
		<h1 class="title is-6">hai</h1>
		<p class="subtitle is-7">hallootjes</p>
		<span class="price">gratis</span>
	</div>
	<a href="./" class="card-link"></a>
</div>

YML data

classes: null
card-image:
  image:
    size: is-square
    alt: Placeholder image
    url: choco-eieren.jpeg
title: hai
subtitle: hallootjes
price: gratis

Collapsible

A simple collapsible component to show and hide content

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the collapsible
  • visible-text the text that's always visible
  • show-btn-text the clickable text to show the invisible text
  • invisible-text the invisible text that is shown after clicking on the shown-btn-text
  • hide-btn-text the clickable text to hide the invisible text

HTML

YML data

!<tag:yaml.org,2002:js/undefined> ''

Dropdown

Dropdown used for discoverable content. This can be used as an inpage menu or any other content.

Options as passed by the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the container
  • id the id of the dropdown
  • is-hoverable setting this to 1 has the dropdown trigger on hover (pure css). Default is 0
  • label the initial dropdown label
  • items a list of labels to serve as links
    • text the text of the link
    • is-active setting this to 1 adds a visual indicator to the item. Default is 0
    • is-divider setting this to 1 omits the text and adds a horizontal divider instead

Bulma documentation

Dropdown
First link Second link Third link
Fourth link

HTML

<div class="dropdown  js-dropdown" id="dropdown-menu">
	<div class="dropdown-trigger">
		<span class="button" aria-haspopup="true" aria-controls="dropdown-menu">Dropdown</span>
	</div>
	<div class="dropdown-menu" role="menu">
		<div class="dropdown-content">
			<a class="dropdown-item ">First link</a>
			<a class="dropdown-item ">Second link</a>
			<a class="dropdown-item ">Third link</a>
			<hr class="dropdown-divider" />
			<a class="dropdown-item ">Fourth link</a>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

YML data

classes: null
id: dropdown-menu
is-hoverable: 0
label: Dropdown
items:
  - text: First link
  - text: Second link
    is-active: 0
  - text: Third link
  - is-divider: 1
  - text: Fourth link

Dynamic Template

A prototype to load materials and their data dynamically, essentially creating Content Slots.

Partials will be listed here:

Usage: {{slot [material-name] | [data object]}}

Lorem ipsum

Button
One Two Three
Four Five Six
Seven Eight Nine
Ten Eleven Twelve
Name Date Available
John Doe 12-12-2018 x
Jane Smith 07-06-2018 x

Message header

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque risus mi, tempus quis placerat ut, porta nec nulla. Vestibulum rhoncus ac ex sit amet fringilla et dictum felis venenatis efficitur. Aenean ac eleifend lacus, in mollis lectus. Donec sodales, arcu et sollicitudin porttitor.

This is important

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque risus mi, tempus quis placerat ut, porta nec nulla. Vestibulum rhoncus ac ex sit amet fringilla et dictum felis venenatis efficitur. Aenean ac eleifend lacus, in mollis lectus. Donec sodales, arcu et sollicitudin porttitor.

	<h3 class="title is-3 ">Lorem ipsum</h3>

	<a href="#" class="button is-dark">


	</a>

		Button
	</a>

				<th class="">Three</th>
			</tr>
		</thead>
		<tbody>
			<tr class="">
				<td class="">Four</td>
				<td class="">Five</td>
				<td class="">Six</td>
			</tr>
			<tr class="">
				<td class="">Seven</td>
				<td class="">Eight</td>
				<td class=""><a href="">Nine</a></td>
			</tr>
		</tbody>
		<tfoot>
			<tr class="">
				<th class="">Ten</th>
				<th class="">Eleven</th>
				<th class="">Twelve</th>
			</tr>
		</tfoot>
	</table>

	<table class="table  is-fullwidth">
		<thead>
			<tr class="">
				<th class="">Name</th>
				<th class="">Date</th>
				<th class="">Available</th>
			</tr>
		</thead>
		<tbody>
			<tr class="">
				<td class="">John Doe</td>
				<td class="">12-12-2018</td>
				<td class="">x</td>
			</tr>
			<tr class="">
				<td class="">Jane Smith</td>
				<td class="">07-06-2018</td>
				<td class="">x</td>
			</tr>
		</tbody>
	</table>

	<div class="message ">
		<div class="message-header">
			<p>Message header</p>

		</div>
		<div class="message-body">
			Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. <strong>Pellentesque risus mi</strong>, tempus quis placerat ut, porta nec nulla. Vestibulum <a href="">rhoncus ac</a> ex sit amet fringilla et dictum felis venenatis efficitur. Aenean ac eleifend lacus, in mollis lectus. Donec sodales, arcu et sollicitudin porttitor.
		</div>
	</div>

	<div class="message is-info">
		<div class="message-header">
			<p>This is important</p>
			<button class="delete"></button>
		</div>
		<div class="message-body">
			Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. <strong>Pellentesque risus mi</strong>, tempus quis placerat ut, porta nec nulla. Vestibulum <a href="">rhoncus ac</a> ex sit amet fringilla et dictum felis venenatis efficitur. Aenean ac eleifend lacus, in mollis lectus. Donec sodales, arcu et sollicitudin porttitor.
		</div>
	</div>

</div>

Form Fields

A dynamic formsection used for forms.
These are datadriven (yaml or json) and generate formsections based on form basics, to ensure consistent markup and layout.
The data structure consists of the section name, section properties and element properties. See src/data/example-forms.yml for an example and rationale.

Section properties include:

  • field-classes a list of classnames to wrap the field in. Could be used for styling or javascript purposes.
  • control-classes a list of classnames to wrap the formelement in. Could be used for styling or javascript purposes.
  • is-horizontal setting this to 1 will create an inline field row rather than a stacked one. Default is 0.
  • help-text The tooltip text. Leaving this blank will omit the help section altogether.
  • help-classes a list of classnames to wrap the help-text in. Could be used for styling or javascript purposes.

The partial takes two parameters: content which points towards the data yml, and type which tells the partial which form element should be loaded.
Type options include: select, input, radio, checkbox, textarea, file. Specific settings are described on the Basics page.

Labels for checkbox and radio groups
Specifying a label.text in the data creates a header to go with the checkbox or radio group. This is different than the checkbox.label and radio.label as it's only used as a header. If you only want to specify the element's (clickable) label, leave this blank.

Note Using this partial without a data file will result in a default fallback. This is not visible in Fabricator however but can be seen in an example structure.

Bulma documentation Includes alternative form layouts

HTML

<div class="field  ">
	<label class="label " for="label-example">Default label</label>
	<div class="control ">
	</div>
</div>

Hero

An imposing hero section to showcase something, typically at the top of a page.

Options as passed by the data:

  • classes: a list of classnames for the container
  • size: the height of the section. Valid options are is-medium, is-large and is-fullheight. Leaving this blank will adjust the height to the hero's content.
  • is-bold: setting this to 1 adds a gradient to the chosen colour. Expects one of the colours being used. Default is 0
  • lines: loads a Title basic per Line entry, with Options defined in the hero's yml.

The content of the Hero is defined via basics within the structure, which in turn load their respective data

Bulma documentation

Het goede leven

Lekker thuis bakken

HTML

<section class="hero is-medium ">
	<div class="hero-body">
		<div class="container">
			<p class="title is-5"><span class="is-white-marked">Het goede leven</span></p>
			<!--  -->
			<p class="subtitle is-2"><span class="is-white-marked">Lekker thuis bakken</span></p>
			<!--  -->
			<a href="overview.html" class="button hero-btn is-dark">
				<img class="btn-icon" src="../assets/toolkit/images/temp/icon-arrow-right.svg" alt="Arrow right icon" />

			</a>
		</div>
	</div>
</section>

YML data

classes: null
size: is-medium
is-bold: 0
lines:
  - classes: title
    text: Het goede leven
    size: 5
    is-white-marked: 1
  - classes: subtitle
    text: Lekker thuis bakken
    size: 2
    is-white-marked: 1
button:
  element: null
  type: null
  url: overview.html
  classes: hero-btn is-dark
  text: null
  icon: temp/icon-arrow-right.svg
  icon-description: Arrow right icon
  is-disabled: 0
  is-static: 0
  is-rounded: 0
  is-inverted: 0
  is-outlined: 0

Menu

A simple menu typically used for vertical navigation.

Options as passed by the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the menu container
  • groups each instance generates a menu group using the following options:
    • label the menu group's label. Optional
    • items a list of menu items, each with the following keys
      • text the text of the link
      • is-active setting this to 1 adds a visual indicator to this menu item. Default is 0.
      • subitems a list of submenu items, each with the same keys as mentioned above ie text and is-active

Bulma documentation

Menu group

  • First link
  • Second link
    • 1st Subitem
    • 2nd Subitem
    • 3rd Subitem
  • Third link

Another group

  • First link
  • Second link

HTML

<div class="menu ">
	<p class="menu-label">Menu group</p>

	<ul class="menu-list">
		<li><a class="">First link</a>
		</li>
		<li><a class="">Second link</a>
			<ul>
				<li><a class="">1st Subitem</a></li>
				<li><a class="">2nd Subitem</a></li>
				<li><a class="">3rd Subitem</a></li>
			</ul>
		</li>
		<li><a class="">Third link</a>
		</li>
	</ul>
	<p class="menu-label">Another group</p>

	<ul class="menu-list">
		<li><a class="">First link</a>
		</li>
		<li><a class="">Second link</a>
		</li>
	</ul>
</div>

YML data

classes: null
groups:
  - label: Menu group
    items:
      - text: First link
      - text: Second link
        is-active: 0
        subitems:
          - text: 1st Subitem
            is-active: 0
          - text: 2nd Subitem
            is-active: 0
          - text: 3rd Subitem
            is-active: 0
      - text: Third link
        is-active: 0
  - label: Another group
    items:
      - text: First link
      - text: Second link

Message

Messages

Options as passed by the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the message component. Supports colour and size modifiers
  • header an optional short header that acts as a subject for the message
    • has-delete (requires a header) setting this to 1 adds a delete button to the message. Default is 0
  • text the actual message. HTML is allowed if properly escaped

Bulma documentation

Message header

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque risus mi, tempus quis placerat ut, porta nec nulla. Vestibulum rhoncus ac ex sit amet fringilla et dictum felis venenatis efficitur. Aenean ac eleifend lacus, in mollis lectus. Donec sodales, arcu et sollicitudin porttitor.

HTML

<div class="message ">
	<div class="message-header">
		<p>Message header</p>

	</div>
	<div class="message-body">
		Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. <strong>Pellentesque risus mi</strong>, tempus quis placerat ut, porta nec nulla. Vestibulum <a href="">rhoncus ac</a> ex sit amet fringilla et dictum felis venenatis efficitur. Aenean ac eleifend lacus, in mollis lectus. Donec sodales, arcu et sollicitudin porttitor.
	</div>
</div>

YML data

classes: null
header: Message header
has-delete: 0
text: >-
  Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. <strong>Pellentesque
  risus mi</strong>, tempus quis placerat ut, porta nec nulla. Vestibulum <a
  href="">rhoncus ac</a> ex sit amet fringilla et dictum felis venenatis
  efficitur. Aenean ac eleifend lacus, in mollis lectus. Donec sodales, arcu et
  sollicitudin porttitor.

Modal

A classic modal overlay, in which you can include any content you want.

The modal is best previewed outside of the toolkit.

Options

  • classes a list of classnames for the container
  • id the id of the modal
  • title the Title of modal. Can be left blank for no title
  • has-close Whether to show the close button
  • footer Adds a footer container with the following buttons:
    • text the text of the button
    • classes a list of classnames for the button

Blocks

  • modal-body Body of the modal. This is added via the page rather than the yml.

Trigger
<a class='js-modal' data-modal-target='id'></a>

Material can be used with

{{#>modal}}
  {{#*inline 'modal-body'}}
  [your content here]
  {{/inline}}
{{/modal}}

Bulma documentation

Bij Dille & Kamille is de natuur onze grootste bron van inspiratie, iets wat ons heel dierbaar is en waar we goed voor willen zorgen. Daarom kiezen we voor een duurzame website.


Deze pagina stoot 1,12 gram CO2 uit en bespaard gemiddeld 3,49 gram C02. Dat is 76% minder dan de gemiddelde website!

Stel je voor dat we 10,000 bezoekers per maand hebben voor een jaar lang, dan besparen we evenveel CO2 als 18 bomen gemiddeld in een jaar absorberen!

Wil jij ook een duurzame website? Maar weet je niet waar je moet beginnen?

Ontdek het dan hier!

HTML

<div class="modal " id="example-modal">
	<div class="modal-card">
		<header class="modal-card-head">
			<button class="delete" aria-label="close" data-modal-close></button>
			<figure class="image  ">
				<img src="./../assets/toolkit/images/temp/logo-sustainable-website-white.svg" alt="Logo sustainable website" />
			</figure>
		</header>
		<section class="modal-card-body">
			<p class="paragraph">Bij Dille & Kamille is de natuur onze grootste bron van inspiratie, iets wat ons heel dierbaar is en waar we goed voor willen zorgen.
				Daarom kiezen we voor een duurzame website.</p>
			</br>
			<div class="sustainable-insight columns is-mobile">
				<figure class="image column is-one-quarter-mobile is-one-fifth-tablet">
					<img src="./../assets/toolkit/images/temp/icon-carbon.svg" alt="Icon tree">
				</figure>
				<p class="column">Deze pagina stoot 1,12 gram CO2 uit en bespaard gemiddeld 3,49 gram C02. Dat is 76% minder dan de gemiddelde website!</p>
			</div>
			<div class="sustainable-insight columns is-mobile">
				<p class="column">Stel je voor dat we 10,000 bezoekers per maand hebben voor een jaar lang, dan <b>besparen</b> we evenveel CO2 als 18 bomen gemiddeld in een jaar absorberen!</p>
				<!-- <figure class="image column is-one-fifth">
					<img src="./../assets/toolkit/images/temp/icon-tree.svg" alt="Icon tree">
				</figure> -->
			</div>
		</section>
		<footer class="modal-card-foot">
			<!--  -->
			<p>Wil jij ook een duurzame website? Maar weet je niet waar je moet beginnen?</p>
			<a href="https://sustainablewebpractices.netlify.app/" class="button ">Ontdek het dan hier!</a>
			<!--  -->
		</footer>
	</div>
	<!-- 
	<button class="modal-close is-large" data-modal-close></button>
	 -->
</div>

YML data

classes: null
id: example-modal
modal-image:
  image:
    size: null
    alt: Logo sustainable website
    url: temp/logo-sustainable-website-white.svg
title: 0
has-close: 1
footer:
  - text: Wil jij ook een duurzame website? Maar weet je niet waar je moet beginnen?
    classes: null
    href: 'https://sustainablewebpractices.netlify.app/'
    btn-text: Ontdek het dan hier!

Notification

A clear notification block used to alert of convey a message.

Options as passed by the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the notification wrapper. Supports colour modifiers
  • text the text to appear in the notification box. HTML is allowed if escaped properly
  • has-delete setting this to 1 adds a delete button. Default is 0

Bulma documentation

Deze pagina bespaardt 76% CO2!

HTML

<div class="notification ">

	Deze pagina bespaardt 76% CO2!
</div>

YML data

classes: null
text: Deze pagina bespaardt 76% CO2!
has-delete: 0

Pagination

Pagination with builtin responsive behaviour.

Options as passed by the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the pagination container. Supports size and style modifiers.
  • is-centered setting this to 1 centers the pagination list while placing the previous and next buttons at either side. Default is 0
  • is-right setting this to 1 moves the pagination list to the right while placing the previous and next buttons on the left. Default is 0
  • has-range setting this to 1 adds ellipses as seperators between the first and last items in the list. Default is 0
  • has-increments setting this to 1 adds Previous and Next buttons. Default is 0

Bulma documentation

  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4

HTML

<nav class="pagination  " role="navigation" aria-label="pagination">
	<ul class="pagination-list">
		<li><a class="pagination-link" aria-label="Goto page 1">1</a></li>
		<li><a class="pagination-link is-current" aria-label="Goto page 2">2</a></li>
		<li><a class="pagination-link" aria-label="Goto page 3">3</a></li>
		<li><a class="pagination-link" aria-label="Goto page 4">4</a></li>
	</ul>
</nav>

YML data

classes: null
is-centered: 0
is-right: 0
has-range: 0
has-increments: 0

Paragraph

Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Nullam id dolor id nibh ultricies vehicula ut id elit. Nullam quis risus eget urna mollis ornare vel eu leo. Fusce dapibus, tellus ac cursus commodo, tortor mauris condimentum nibh, ut fermentum massa justo sit amet risus. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec ullamcorper nulla non metus auctor fringilla. Donec id elit non mi porta gravida at eget metus.

HTML

<p>Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Nullam id dolor id nibh ultricies vehicula ut id elit. Nullam quis risus eget urna mollis ornare vel eu leo. Fusce dapibus, tellus ac cursus commodo, tortor mauris condimentum nibh, ut fermentum massa justo sit amet risus. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec ullamcorper nulla non metus auctor fringilla. Donec id elit non mi porta gravida at eget metus.</p>

Tabs

Horizontal navigational tabs.

Options as passed by the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the tabs container. Supports size modifiers.
  • is-fullwidth setting this to 1 make the tabs take up the full width of the container. Default is 0
  • is-centered setting this to 1 places the tabs in the center of the container. Default is 0
  • if-right setting this to 1 places the tabs on the right side of the container. Default is 0
  • is-boxed setting this to 1 gives the tabs a more classic, boxy feel. Default is 0
  • is-toggle setting this to 1 makes the tabs look like mutually exclusive buttons. Default is 0
    • is-toggle-rounded setting this to 1 rounds out the first and last tabs. Requires is-toggle to be 1. Default is 0.
  • items a list of tabs, each with the following keys:
    • text the tab's text
    • is-active setting this to 1 adds a visual indicator to this tab. Default is 0

Bulma documentation

  • First link
  • Second link
  • Third link
  • Fourth link

HTML

<div class="tabs ">
	<ul>
		<li class=""><a>First link</a></li>
		<li class=""><a>Second link</a></li>
		<li class=""><a>Third link</a></li>
		<li class=""><a>Fourth link</a></li>
	</ul>
</div>

YML data

classes: null
is-toggle: 0
is-toggle-rounded: 0
is-fullwidth: 0
is-centered: 0
is-right: 0
is-boxed: 0
items:
  - text: First link
    is-active: 0
  - text: Second link
  - text: Third link
  - text: Fourth link
